body.p: Some two years ago a man by the name of John Perringer came to me & demanded a Peace Warrent against John Reester for having made some threats that he intended to whip Perringer the warrent was granted & the parties were before me in order to settle the matter as is my custom I bound Reester over to keep the peace in the sum of one hundred dollas I believe & to appear at the next Equity & Criminal Court, at which time S. L. Kohn an honest Old duchman all ways ready to releave the distressed steped forward & went Reesters security, in a very short time afterwards Reester left this place & went to Louisville or some where in that region of country & I have understood died when the court came on & Reester having died the Old man Kohn did not think he had aney thing further to do & consqutley did not make his appearance in court, & the result was a fine; there was a petition sent up to your Honor some twelve months ago asking you to remit the fine as it stood against the Old man Kohn & you was pleased to respite the fine for 12 months he paying the cost which he has done I do think sir if ever your Excellency had a case presented that demanded your kind attention this is one of that class I do hope sir that your kind & benevolent hart will ^be^ prompted to releave this kind harted Old man from the payment of the above named fine

Warren
E & C Ct
$100 } For Recog
P. S Kohn
Remission Issd
Feby 15. 1861
